entity.Name: Account

Description.description: Business that represents a customer or potential customer. The company that is billed in business transactions.
Drop-down list for selecting the category of the account.
Select a category to indicate whether the customer account is standard or preferred.
Drop-down list for classifying an account.
Select a classification code to indicate the potential value of the customer account based on the projected return on investment, cooperation level, sales cycle length or other criteria.
Unique identifier of the account.
Type an ID number or code for the account to quickly search and identify the account in system views.
Drop-down list for selecting account ratings.
Select a rating to indicate the value of the customer account.
Type of address for address 1, such as billing, shipping, or primary address.
Select the primary address type.
Type the city for the primary address.
Shows the complete primary address.
Type the country or region for the primary address.
Type the county for the primary address.
Type the fax number associated with the primary address.
Freight terms for address 1.
Select the freight terms for the primary address to make sure shipping orders are processed correctly.
Type the first line of the primary address.
Type the ZIP Code or postal code for the primary address.
Type the name of the main contact at the account's primary address.
Method of shipment for address 1.
Select a shipping method for deliveries sent to this address.
Type the state or province of the primary address.
Type the UPS zone of the primary address to make sure shipping charges are calculated correctly and deliveries are made promptly, if shipped by UPS.
Type the city for the secondary address.
Shows the complete secondary address.
Type the fax number associated with the secondary address.
Type the first line of the secondary address.
Type the name of the main contact at the account's secondary address.
Type the UPS zone of the secondary address to make sure shipping charges are calculated correctly and deliveries are made promptly, if shipped by UPS.
For system use only.
For system use only.
For system use only.
Type of business associated with the account.
Select the legal designation or other business type of the account for contracts or reporting purposes.
Shows who created the record.
Shows the external party who created the record.
Shows the date and time when the record was created. The date and time are displayed in the time zone selected in Microsoft Dynamics 365 options.
Shows who created the record on behalf of another user.
Type the credit limit of the account. This is a useful reference when you address invoice and accounting issues with the customer.
Information about whether credit for the account is on hold.
Select whether the credit for the account is on hold. This is a useful reference while addressing the invoice and accounting issues with the customer.
Size of the account.
Select the size category or range of the account for segmentation and reporting purposes.
Type of the account.
Select the category that best describes the relationship between the account and your organization.
Choose the default price list associated with the account to make sure the correct product prices for this customer are applied in sales opportunities, quotes, and orders.
Type additional information to describe the account, such as an excerpt from the company's website.
Information about whether to allow sending direct email to the account.
Select whether the account allows bulk email sent through campaigns. If Do Not Allow is selected, the account can be added to marketing lists, but is excluded from email.
Information about whether to allow sending bulk-rate postal mail to the account.

Select whether the account allows bulk postal mail sent through marketing campaigns or quick campaigns. If Do Not Allow is selected, the account can be added to marketing lists, but will be excluded from the postal mail.
Information about whether to allow sending email to the account.
Select whether the account allows direct email sent from Microsoft Dynamics 365.
Information about whether to allow sending faxes to the account.
Select whether the account allows faxes. If Do Not Allow is selected, the account will be excluded from fax activities distributed in marketing campaigns.
Information about whether to allow phone calls to the account.
Select whether the account allows phone calls. If Do Not Allow is selected, the account will be excluded from phone call activities distributed in marketing campaigns.
Information about whether to allow sending postal mail to the account.
Select whether the account allows direct mail. If Do Not Allow is selected, the account will be excluded from letter activities distributed in marketing campaigns.
Information on whether to allow sending marketing mail to the account.
Select whether the account accepts marketing materials, such as brochures or catalogs.
Type the primary email address for the account.
Type the secondary email address for the account.
Type an alternate email address for the account.
Type the fax number for the account.
Select whether the account allows tracking email activities sent from Microsoft Dynamics 365. If Do Not Allow is selected, Microsoft Dynamics 365 will not track the email.
Information about whether to allow following email activity like opens, attachment views and link clicks for emails sent to the account.
Type the URL for the account's FTP site to enable users to access data and share documents.
Field used to indicate whether the customer requires Acknowledgement & Updates to be completed in a 3rd Party Work Order system
This is the access code to the building (Numeric Code). To be used by Named Service Technician. Field will not be available to Sales personelles
This is the access code to the building (Numeric Code). To be used by Named Service Technician. Field will not be available to Sales personelles
Date of expiration of access requirement
Does this unit require access instructions?
Does this unit require access instructions?
Instructions for unit access URL
NSA code or customer group that describes a framework agreement (prices, rates, terms & conditions) allows to regroup multiple accounts which similar conditions. More likely used by Key accounts.
Unique identifier for Special Instructions associated with Account & Building.
Is this account public or private?
Is this customer a customer, prospect, or third party (consultant, architect)?
Free text field to maintain additional address nodes about the account. This cannot be used for marketing campaigns.
The name of the smallest business unit.
Brand Associated with the Branch
Company that is managing the Building (Could be different from the owner).
Concatenated field: Standard Building Hours, Access Code 1, Access Code 2
Set the date that building access shall be reviewed to ensure information is valid
Description enabling the sales/ service personnel to have access to building (e.g. Check in Check out time, Admin offic location etc)
Number of Active Buildings on the account
Unique identifier for Special Instructions associated with Account & Building.
GSS generated unique number Building ID
Account information to link building. Select Account or Contact as the owner of the building.
Number of call backs for a unit

displayname.description: Case Requires Customer Work/Purchase Order Number

Description.description: This field will update the Case form to notify the CSR rep that the Customer Work Order / Purchase Order Number will be required on Case

displayname.description: Case Requires Customer Work/Purchase Order Number

Description.description: This field will update the Case form to notify the CSR rep that the Customer Work Order / Purchase Order Number will be required on Case
Check-in date and time upon visiting the building
Does the building require the Field Service personnel to Check-in and check-out every time they visit the building?
Check-out date and time upon visiting the building
Number of Active Contract
The expiration date of the contract expiring first in the future
Credit risk rating of the account (JDE)
Value of the Customer Budget in base currency.
Either manually filled or coming from the voice of the customer survey.

Enables the Otisline Agent to record the customers temperament at the time of the call to create a record of the callers demeanor. This field is populated with a subjective assessment by the Otis Line
Pick which Time Zone does the building fall in.
Contact Personelle for the Service Sales team to connect with during normal business hours
ERP Billing Address
ERP Billing City
ERP Billing Country
ERP Billing State
ERP Billing Address Street 1
ERP Billing Address Street 2
ERP Billing Address Street 3
ERP Tax ID
ERP Billing Postal Code

displayname.description: Est. Total Units not on Contract

Description.description: Estimated total number of units in a portfolio of accounts
The 12-month period that the account uses for budgeting, forecasting, and reporting purposes.

displayname.description: Fiscal Year Start - DO NOT USE

Description.description: The unique ID provided by the government to identify the account (siret code in France)
Preferred method of delivery for the account.
Preferred method of delivery for the account.
The business level at which the account is managed by OTIS for negotiations (global, area, regional, local)
EMEA - Flag if key data elements for an account record are populated
Name of the person who created the record in the source system
Shows the date and time when the record was created in the source system
Primary ID from the source system
Name of the person who last updated the record in the source system
Shows the date and time when the record was last updated the record in the source system
Identify the source system the data is migrated from
Accounts receivable status for Maintenance
Margin of O Orders at account level
Margin of S Orders at account level
Margin of T Orders at account level
The industry or domain in which the account does business (WHQ-defined categories).
The industry or domain in which the account does business (Region-defined matched with the WHQ categories).
This indicates whether OTIS can conduct business with this account depending on the denied party screening.
Modernization budget at account level
Value of the Mod Budget in base currency.
Accounts receivable status for Modernization orders
Does the Building have Units which are serviced by alternate service providers
New Equipment Accounts receivable status
NPS score rolled up at account level
Description of Actions as part of Account planning
Contact Personelle for the Service Sales team to connect with during non-business hours
Number of floors in the building
Total number of units on the Account
Accounts receivable for Open orders
The estimated amount the account is ready to spend for orders during the fiscal year.
Value of the Open Order Budget in base currency.
Sum of Margins for Open Orders a+ T Orders
Type of Building ownership
Preferred language which account wants to conduct business. Default value is preferred language of the OTIS branch.
Preferred name by sales rep when addressing an account
Primary contact used for billing purposes.
Primary contact used for facilities related to account
Linking the Building record Account
Total revenue from Maintenance Orders
Value of the Revenue O in base currency.
Total revenue from Modernization Orders
Value of the Revenue S in base currency.
Total revenue from Open Orders
Value of the Revenue T in base currency.
Describes the overall rise group of the building. Example Low Rise, Mid Rise, High Rise.
Describes the overall rise group of the building. Example Low Rise, Mid Rise, High Rise.
Risk Score for the customer (JDE)

displayname.description: S as a % of O Revenue

Description.description: Modernization revenue as a % of maintenance revenue
Date when segmentation was updated (JDE)
Share of wallet for OTIS as a % of total annual spend by customer
Value of the Share of Wallet in base currency.
Share of wallet for OTIS as a % of total annual spend by customer
Special clearance type required for user access
Free Text to record the standard hours of when service work can be done in the building

displayname.description: T as a % of O Revenue

Description.description: Open Order revenue as a % of maintenance revenue
The unique Tax ID to identify the account.
The estimated Total Budget Spent for all providers including competitors during the fiscal year.
Value of the Total Budget Spent in base currency.
Active units on the portfolio
Total count of units off-portfolio
Total number of Units on Portfolio that are suspended
Sum of all units attached to a Portfolio
BEX Account Receivable Status
Unique identifier of the data import or data migration that created this record.
Type of industry with which the account is associated.

label.description: Agriculture and Non-petrol Natural Resource Extraction

Description.description: Select the account's primary industry for use in marketing segmentation and demographic analysis.
Contains the date and time stamp of the last on hold time.
Shows the date when the account was last included in a marketing campaign or quick campaign.
Type the market capitalization of the account to identify the company's equity, used as an indicator in financial performance analysis.
Whether is only for marketing
Whether is only for marketing
Shows who last updated the record.
Shows the external party who modified the record.
Shows the date and time when the record was last updated. The date and time are displayed in the time zone selected in Microsoft Dynamics 365 options.
Shows who created the record on behalf of another user.
Reference to an other account to be used for billing (only to be used if billing account differs)
External Account ID from other systems.
Default Sales Tax Code
The Service Territory this account belongs to. This is used to optimize scheduling and routing
Select whether the account is tax exempt.
Select whether the account is tax exempt.
Shows the government tax exempt number.
Enter the travel charge to include on work orders. This value will be multiplied by the travel charge type.
Specify how travel is charged for this account.
Shows the default instructions to show on new work orders.
Type the company or business name.
Type the number of employees that work at the account for use in marketing segmentation and demographic analysis.
Shows how long, in minutes, that the record was on hold.
Number of open opportunities against an account and its child accounts.
Sum of open revenue against an account and its child accounts.
Value of the Open Revenue in base currency.

Shows the lead that the account was created from if the account was created by converting a lead in Microsoft Dynamics 365. This is used to relate the account to data on the originating lead for use in reporting and analytics.
Date and time that the record was migrated.
Enter the user or team who is assigned to manage the record. This field is updated every time the record is assigned to a different user.
Type of company ownership, such as public or private.
Select the account's ownership structure, such as public or private.
Choose the parent account associated with this account to show parent and child businesses in reporting and analytics.
Payment terms for the account.
Select the payment terms to indicate when the customer needs to pay the total amount.
Time of day that the account prefers for scheduling service activities.
Select the preferred time of day for service appointments.
Preferred contact method for the account.
Select the preferred method of contact.
Choose the account's preferred service facility or equipment to make sure services are scheduled correctly for the customer.
Choose the account's preferred service for reference when you schedule service activities.
Choose the preferred service representative for reference when you schedule service activities for the account.
Primary contact used for sales purposes.
Primary Satori ID for Account
Primary Twitter ID for Account
Type the annual revenue for the account, used as an indicator in financial performance analysis.
Type the number of shares available to the public for the account. This number is used as an indicator in financial performance analysis.
Method of shipment for the account.
Select a shipping method for deliveries sent to the account's address to designate the preferred carrier or other delivery option.
Type the Standard Industrial Classification (SIC) code that indicates the account's primary industry of business, for use in marketing segmentation and demographic analysis.
Choose the service level agreement (SLA) that you want to apply to the Account record.
Status of the account.
Shows whether the account is active or inactive. Inactive accounts are read-only and can't be edited unless they are reactivated.
Reason for the status of the account.
Select the account's status.
Type the stock exchange at which the account is listed to track their stock and financial performance of the company.
Type the main phone number for this account.
Type a second phone number for this account.
Type a third phone number for this account.
Territory to which the account belongs.
Select a region or territory for the account for use in segmentation and analysis.
Choose the sales region or territory for the account to make sure the account is assigned to the correct representative and for use in segmentation and analysis.
Type the stock exchange symbol for the account to track financial performance of the company. You can click the code entered in this field to access the latest trading information from MSN Money.
Type the account's website URL to get quick details about the company profile.

entity.MobileOfflineFilters: <fetch version="1.0" output-format="xml-platform" mapping="logical" distinct="false"><entity name="account"><all-attributes/><filter type="and"><condition attribute="statecode" operator="eq" value="0"/></filter></entity></fetch>

Description.description: This is the account hierarchy definition.
